{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Indian River Lagoon Nutrient Removal Assistance Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Indian River Lagoon Nutrient Removal Assistance Grant Program

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall establish an Indian River Lagoon
			 Nutrient Removal Assistance Grant Program (in this section referred to as
			 the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Administrator of the
			 Environmental Protection Agency

quote.#tail:
) to assist projects related to the protection and restoration of the Indian River Lagoon in
			 Florida.

text.#text: Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may make a grant, on a competitive basis, to any of
			 the following:

text.#text: In carrying out the Program, the
A State government entity.
A local government entity.
A nonprofit organization.
The Indian River Lagoon Program.

shall submit to
			 the

an application with respect to a proposed project at
			 such time, in such form, and containing such information as the

determines is appropriate, which shall include at least a
			 description of the proposed project and the communities to be served by
			 the proposed project.

text.#text: To be eligible for a grant under the Program, an entity specified in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall issue regulations with respect to the criteria to be utilized to select
			 projects for grants under the Program, which shall prioritize projects
			 that—

text.#text: The
produce the greatest nutrient load reductions;
result in the greatest environmental benefits to the Indian River Lagoon; and
advance the goals and objectives of the comprehensive plan.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall consult with—

text.#text: In selecting projects for grants under the Program, the
the Indian River Lagoon Program;
the State of Florida and local governments in the Indian River Lagoon watershed; and

other relevant stakeholders involved with the protection and restoration of the Indian River
			 Lagoon.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the Federal share of the cost of a project assisted with a
			 grant under the Program shall be 75 percent.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Indian River Lagoon Nutrient Removal Assistance Act of 2014/s:2/ss:f/p:2

text.#text: Except as provided in

At the request of a grant recipient, the recipient may lower the Federal share of the cost for a
			 project carried out by the recipient to an amount that is less than 75
			 percent.
